column1: La Marsa (Tunisian Arabic: المرسى‎ Il Marṣā) is a coastal town in far north eastern Tunisia near the capital Tunis. The population is estimated as 92
column3: as of 2014. The old summer capital of pre-colonial Tunisia
column4: it is today a popular vacation spot for many wealthy Tunisians. It is connected to Tunis by the TGM railway. Gammarth is adjacent to El Marsa further up the coast.

column1: Ancient Carthage was a Semitic civilization centered on the Phoenician city-state of Carthage
column2: located in North Africa on the Gulf of Tunis
column4: Tunisia. It was founded in 814 BC. Originally a dependency of the Phoenician state of Tyre
column5: Carthage gained independence around 650 BC and established a hegemony over other Phoenician settlements throughout the Mediterranean
column6: North Africa and what is now Spain which lasted until the end of the 3rd century BC. At the height of the city's prominence
column7: its political influence extended over most of the western Mediterranean and it was one of the major trade hubs.

column2: Carthage was in a constant state of struggle with the Greeks on Sicily and the Roman Republic
column3: which led to a series of armed conflicts known as the Sicilian Wars and Punic Wars. They also had to deal with the volatile Berbers
column4: the indigenous inhabitants of the entire area where Carthage was built. In 146 BC
column5: after the third and final Punic War
column6: Carthage was destroyed and then occupied by Roman forces. Nearly all of the other Phoenician city-states and former Carthaginian dependencies fell into Roman hands from then on.

column1: Abdalliya Palace is one of the most lavish creations Hafsid dynasty sultans. Built in the early sixteenth century by one of their last sovereign
column3: this palace stands on the ancient port site of El Marsa. This place of remembrance and history is one of the few monuments Hafsid Tunisia. It is the oldest evidence of Muslim architecture Palatine remained in good state of conservation of the Maghreb.

column1: The TGM was the first railway in Tunisia and inaugurated in 1872. Since 1905 it has been known as the TGM. It is part of the transportation system of the Tunis area
column2: and together with the light rail of Tunis (Le métro léger de Tunis) managed by the Société des transports de Tunis (Transtu). Transtu was founded in 2003 by joining the Société du métro léger de Tunis (SMLT
column3: founded 1981) and the Société nationale de transports (SNT
column4: founded 1963).Transports that passes through the N9 Highway:

column1: AS MarsaAvenir Sportif de El Marsa (Arabic: المستقبل الرياضي بالمرسى
column2: often referred to as ASM) is a football club from El Marsa in Tunisia.
the team plays in green and yellow colours. Their ground is Stade Abdelaziz Chtioui
